aspect: 1. Paul Merson criticized Andros Townsend's England call-up in his column.
2. Merson took another dig at Townsend after Tottenham's draw with Burnley.
3. Townsend scored a stunning equaliser for England against Italy.
4. Merson admitted he was wrong about Townsend and praised his goal.
5. Townsend hit back at Merson on Twitter after scoring against Italy.
6. The two players seem to have made up but Merson couldn't resist having another dig at Townsend.
explain: Paul Merson criticized Andros Townsend's England call-up by writing a column where he argued that the player was not worthy of being included in the national team's squad.

Paul Merson, a former footballer and pundit, has been critical of Andros Townsend's performance after being called up to the recent England squad. Despite being brought on to the field in injury time in his team's 0-0 draw with Burnley, Merson took another opportunity to criticize Townsend's play. The midfielder has been the target of Merson's criticism in the past as well.

Andros Townsend scored a stunning goal for the England national football team against Italy in a Euro qualifier match. The goal was an excellent piece of individual play, as he received the ball on the right wing, dribbled past two defenders, cut inside a third, and then unleashed a curling shot into the top corner of the net to level the score at 1-1. Townsend's goal will undoubtedly be remembered as one of the standout moments of the Euro qualifying campaign for England, and cemented his place in the starting line-up for the team under new manager Gareth Southgate.
Paul Merson has admitted he was wrong about Andros Townsend and has praised the winger's goal after previously criticizing him.
The given aspect is about the English midfielder Andros Townsend, who scored a goal against Italy in an international match.
It appears that Merson and Townsend have made peace after their earlier disagreement, however, it seems that the former footballer cannot help but take yet another dig at the player.
